topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55978dce63687221ec000163#post_55978dce63687221ec000163
I also liked the little twinges of consciousness he had. Like [spoiler]"I have seen little [looks at Kylie's bare wang then resumes eye contact]  to indicate that could effectively protect Sarah Conner" and the fact that he kept her drawings she made as a kid[/spoiler]

And I like that they went the goofy route with it In places. At this point I honestly think any sequel past the third movie should start delving into goofy shit anyway or else it gets boring. I mean it wasn't exactly highbrow humor but I enjoyed it.

topics.body:
The Non-popable bubble wrap is actually made in a way that there are connections between the 'bubbles'. The reason for this is that conventional bubble wrap is made with the air already inside. The new one is made to be inflated by the packager.

You may ask "y u do dis?". Simple. Because conventional bubble wrap already come pre-inflated, they take up more space in delivery truck when they ship 'em out to the companies who ordered them. The new ones are not yet inflated so one could fill up the trucks more.

The Verdict: the new bubble wrap is more efficient and more eco-friendly but way less fun.

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55978f16636872573c001076#post_55978f16636872573c001076
I thought I saw him look down, that's hilarious 

So, time for least favorite part of movie:
[spoiler]John Connor
His robot form was pretty cool, I loved the design, and he was essentially an upgraded T-1000, with his cool phasing he did in the final battle, was like a fucking video game
I don't understand though why he only pretended to be another pperson once, it's an extremely useful ability

The part I didn't like, was he wouldn't shut up
Terminator baddies are supposed to be quiet and only say a few words, it makes them menacing
John on the other hand wouldn't shut up about how he was the future of man kind, and how they have no chance of stopping him, and bluhbluhbluh[/spoiler]

"@Albus Fahrenheits":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55978ff4636872573c0011f4#post_55978ff4636872573c0011f4
I guess they had the same idea as I did but way too late.
I love playing with bubble wraps but sometimes, there are ones that I can't pop and the reason was that the air inside would be directed to a different bubble. I was a smart kid so I noticed this and deducted the conclusion.

I'm actually surprised it took them this long.

topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559790ed63687221ec000424#post_559790ed63687221ec000424
[spoiler]i think one of the biggest downfalls is that they didn't really try to do anything with the villains even though they had so much dialogue. 
Like I honestly thought they were going to try to have some kind of unification of humans and robots and have the conflict be whether or not they should trust John instead of "nah, john's just evil now and skynet still wants to kill everyone"
That and the fact that John being a terminator is the biggest spoiler in the whole goddamn movie and it's in the trailer.[/spoiler]
